greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Antidiagonal sums of triangle A186084.
comment: Triangle A186084 is the number of 1-dimensional sand piles with n grains and base length k.
The g.f. T(x,y) of triangle A186084 satisfies: T(x,y) = 1/(1 - x*y - x^3*y^2*T(x,x*y)); therefore, the g.f. of this sequence is T(x,x).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f.: (1 - x/(1 - 1/B(x))))/x^3 where B(x) equals the g.f. of the row sums of triangle A186084.
G.f.: 1/x^3 - (Q(0) + 1)/x^2, where Q(k)= 1/x^(k+1) - 1 - 1/Q(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 07 2013
maple: a:= n-> add(coeff(b(n-k, 1), x, k), k=0..n):
mathematica: ContinuedFractionK[f[i], g[i], {i, 0, Sqrt[m] // Ceiling}] + O[x]^m // CoefficientList[#, x]& (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 14 2019, after _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_ *)
program: (PARI) {a(n)=local(Txy=1+x*y); for(i=1, n, Txy=1/(1-x*y-x^3*y^2*subst(Txy, y, x*y+x*O(x^n)))); polcoeff(subst(Txy,y,x), n, x)}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 23 2011
